text:
Social contracts

Is there such a thing as a social contract between voters and elected representatives? Then it is a contract where politicians can go their own way after being elected. Nowadays you see politicians having their own solution which is contrary to the needs of the confronting people. Where are the actions of rational consumers to punish the deviant behavior of elected and sworn advocates who are undergoing a diametrical change in their attitude? In my view, these figures eventually become regents with separate diaries with their own interests that they pursue. According to my views, that must be a huge problem when leaders from a party play a leading role. I describe this as a form of treason. In the end, such a tricycle leads to a coup that no one is waiting for. In my opinion, it would be advisable to introduce more time for the local residents, stakeholders and large groups of people to come to a better solution for existing problems. Nowadays, the dream of large groups of politicians goes so far as to develop a whole new world order outside of their electorate's will, with little future for its inhabitants. According to my opinion, a social contract should no longer be silent with the elected. Beforehand, the representative who wants to be elected should be able to demonstrate on the basis of which this choice should fall within his program. The proposed programs should be calculated by a reliable statistics agency that can show whether or not the program is made of baked air and can or can not be made payable. In other words, where will the affordable resources be obtained?Ôªø

text:
The failure of the summit has way less to do with Trump than it does with Pompeo.  In other words, none of the hawks in DC are willing to realize that the only way to peace is to accept NK as a nuclear state and limit some of it's other military options.  Trump even said: he's willing that NK keep some nukes in exchange for a limit on their ballistic missiles.  Remember, nukes are useless without a delivery system.  But Pompeo and others want "complete denuclearization" which anyone with a brain knows will not happen... Sadam Hussein and Muammar Ghadaffi would still be around if they had nukes, and Kim knows that.  Both he and his father have devoted enormous time and money to providing NK with an effective nuclear deterrent against the United States, which requires the ability to strike the American homeland. He may make all sorts of other deals, but he will never give that up.

North Korea doesn‚Äôt need to match U.S. nuclear capabilities ‚Äì the ability to deliver only a few nuclear weapons on American soil would be a sufficient deterrent.  There is no deal available that would protect North Korea from U.S. nuclear weapons, since they can reach the North directly from the United States. No amount of local disarmament ‚Äì the withdrawal of American troops from South Korea, even the withdrawal of American nuclear weapons from all of East Asia ‚Äì could change that reality, and the United States is not planning to abolish its strategic nuclear deterrent.

The only safe road to the future, therefore, is a political deal that greatly reduces tensions between the two countries while acknowledging that a state of mutual nuclear deterrence will henceforward prevail between them.

Mutual deterrence is what has now obtained for a long time between the United States and its two peer rivals, Russia and China. The huge asymmetry between the power of the U.S. and North Korea does not lead to a different conclusion. Nuclear weapons are the great leveller: in practical terms, just a few are enough to deter, even if the other side has hundreds of times as many (which the United States does).


The kind of concessions that could help include a gradual relaxation of the sanctions that stifle the North Korean economy and a formal peace treaty ending the 1950-53 Korean War, perhaps in return for very big cuts in North Korea‚Äôs huge conventional army (twice the size of South Korea‚Äôs, in a country with half the population).

Later on, there could be talks about permanently capping the number of North Korean nuclear weapons and intercontinental missiles (which is still in the dozens, not the thousands), in return for withdrawing some or all of the U.S. troops from South Korea.


Problem is, few Americans are ready yet to accept that this is the logic of the situation.Ôªø

A truly historic election result with the margin of seats won, candidates, and the electorate coming out like never before during midterms, bigger than the GOP in 1994 and Tea Party/GOP in 2010. Democracy thrives when voters participate in the process. Even if Trump committed multiple crimes and more comes out about his unethical and shady practices before and during his presidency I think Congress should not impeach him. Gather the facts. Do their jobs of oversight which use to be a thing before Donnie came along. And present it to the American people. The 2020 election will take place with full transparency and the people will elect their choice. Simple. After 2 years of this presidency the result was a historic midterm that changed the balance of power in Washington D.C. and some of the same people that voted for Trump helped flip the House and take over almost half the state houses and governorships. So...that base is shrinking and only in their closed minds they don't see the warning signs. Trump could have been so much better at representing the country with dignity, respect, and compassion. He could have healed a nation. It was never meant to be. Don the Con did a number on so many people and they have lived through these last 2 years wondering if this is a bad dream. If they choose another 4 years of this madness and embarrassment in 2020 then we can no longer say it was the Russians, bribes and felony payments to a porn star and playmate, or that voters didn't know exactly who they were voting for and how he ran his businesses and interacted with foreign governments as an asset. Everything will be known. In the open. We are Americans before we are republicans or democrats. The United States of America will choose and they will live with this decision, along with the generations to follow, knowing this experiment with democracy was never completed. The founding fathers were striving for a more perfect union and that government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth. God bless and keep you and yours for all eternity and may God bless these United States of America.               CheersÔªø
